document.masterDocTitle: Coralliophilinae (Neogastropoda: Muricidae) from the southwest Pacific

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Coralliophilinae (Neogastropoda: Muricidae) from the southwest Pacific
Mémoires du Muséum national d'Histoire naturelle

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Trichotropis dorbignyanum Petit de la Saussaye, 1851: 261
, pl. 7, fig. 2.

subSubSection.paragraph:
TYPE MATERIAL. —
Cantharus erosus
: unknown. —
Pyrula abbreviata
: 2 possible syntypes MHNG 1098 /69/1, 36.0 mm, and MHNG 1098 /69/2, 37.9 mm
. —
Murex plicatus
: unknown. —
Pyrula deformis
: holotype MHNG 1098 /71
. —
Rapana fragilis
: holotype BMNH 1984100 , figured by Kosuge & Suzuki (1985: pl. 38, fig. 8)
. —
Trichotropis dorbignyanum
: probable holotype MNHN 4633 , figured by Kosuge & Suzuki (1985: pl. 38, figs 3, 4)
. —
Rapana suturalis
: syntype BMNH 1984113 , figured by Kosuge & Suzuki (1985: pl. 38 figs 5, 6)
. —
Rapana coralliophila
: syntype BMNH 1984111 , figured by Kosuge & Suzuki (1985: pl. 46, fig. 6)
. —
Rhizochilus exaratus
: lectotype BMNH 1961177 , and 2 paralectotypes BMNH 1961178 , selected by Kay (1965); lectotype figured by Kay (1965, pl. 4, figs 19-11) and by Kosuge & Suzuki (1985: pl. 38, fig. 7, “ex Kay 1965”)
. —
Coralliophila stearnsiana
: holotype USNM 46377 , figured by Kosuge & Suzuki (1985: pl. 38, fig. 11)
. —
Coralliophila groschi
: holotype NM H382 - T2047 , figured by Kosuge & Suzuki (1985: pl. 38, fig. 9)
.

TYPE LOCALITY. —
C. erosus
: not designated. —
P. abbreviata
: not indicated. —
M. plicatus
: “ East Indies ”
. —
P. deformis
: unknown. —
R. fragilis
: Philippines . —
T. dorbignyanum
: “Taiti” on the probable holotype’s label ( MNHN ), “Océan Pacifique, M. Bernardi” ( Petit de la Saussaye 1851 )
. —
R. suturalis : Bulusan
, Province of Albay , Luzon, Philippines
. —
R. coralliophila : Isle
of Ticao, on reefs at low water. —
R. exaratus : Hawaiian Islands
[ Sandwich Islands ]
. —
C. stearnsiana
: Lower California
. —
C. groschi
: east of Posto Lunga , Lunga Bay , northern Mozambique
.
MATERIAL EXAMINED. — Coral Sea . CORAIL 2: stn DW 84, 1 dd; stn 1259, 20°44.6’S , 165°13.7’E , 15-35 m , 1 dd.

DISTRIBUTION. — Indo-West Pacific ( Kay 1979 ). From Izu Peninsula ( Japan ) to tropical Indo-Pacific (Tsuchiya 2000), “intertidal to 20 m , on
Acropora
,
Scleractinia
[ sic ] and other corals” (
Higo et al . 2001: 216
). Coral Sea, New Caledonia and Loyalty Islands , empty shells intertidal to
57 m .

REMARKS. — Protoconch of 3.3 whorls, 540 Μm high and 675 Μm wide at the base. Protoconch-I of about 1 whorl, sculptured with pustules over the entire surface. Protoconch-II of about 2.3 whorls, with 2 spiral keels (the abapical starting on the second protoconch whorl, the adapical starting on the third), sculptured by a series of subsutural prosocline threads and a series of similar threads over each keel; the 2 adapical series of threads tend to fuse giving rise to collabral riblets. A diffuse granulation is present in the interspaces. This description does not agree with the paucispiral protoconch of “
C. erosa
” as figured (drawing) by D’Attilio & Myers (1984 : figs 32, 33).

Rather variable, as suggested by the long synonymy, its inclusion in
Coralliophila
s.l .
is supported by molecular data ( Oliverio & Mariottini 2001a ;
Oliverio et al . 2002
). It is found mainly on
Acropora
-like corals. A handwritten note by Lamarck’s daughter in Lamarck’s copy of Animaux sans vertèbres (in MNHG) indicates the presence of 7 specimens in her father’s collection, but there are now only 2 specimens in the Lamarck collection at MHNG. Lamarck indicated a size of 40 mm . The locality indicated on the label (not an original label of Lamarck) is “Oc. indien” (Y. Finet, pers. comm.). For
P. deformis , Lamarck
indicated a size of about “1 pouce”, i.e. about 27 mm , and the holotype is 25.3 mm long (Y. Finet, pers. comm.).
